definition: variant of 熱衷|热衷[re4 zhong1]
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: Many merchants were not slow to cash in on the current China craze.
sentences.chinese: 许多商人都急于在流行的中国热中捞一把。

sentences.english: And yet this was Joe, whom he had always liked. But Joe was too keen with life.
sentences.chinese: 这人是他一向喜欢的乔，而乔正热中着生活。

sentences.english: She is happily married to her husband Joe, a business executive and avid boater .
sentences.chinese: 她愉快地与结婚对她的丈夫乔，商业主管和热中船民。

sentences.english: The doodle is the latest in the recent rehabilitation of Confucius.
sentences.chinese: 在近来孔子复兴热中这个涂鸦是最新的表现。

sentences.english: They were full of envy, murder, strife, deceit, maliciousness.
sentences.chinese: 他们妒忌，满怀杀机，热中纷争，欺诈，用心险恶。

definition: to be in vogue/to be prevalent
to be infatuated with/to be enchanted by/to be passionate about
to be all the same way (literary)
even/going as far as to/so much so that
addicted to/fond of/stem corresponding to -phil or -phile
